channel.title: Writeups on Antonio Ortiz
channel.description: Recent content in Writeups on Antonio Ortiz

item.title: Agent Sudo
item.description: Agent Sudo You found a secret server located under the deep sea. Your task is to hack inside the server and reveal the truth. Agent Sudo, a CTF room with an alien theme! As always, we’ll start with adding the target machine’s IP address to our hosts file. echo target-ip agentsudo.thm >> /etc/hosts Now lets move on to the room’s tasks. Enumerate We’ll start by running an nmap scan of the target.

item.title: RootMe
item.description: RootMe A ctf for beginners, can you root me? Here’s a Link to the room. First, I’m going to add the ip address of the machine to my /etc/hosts folder for ease of access. echo target-ip rootme >> /etc/hosts Next, it’s time for some reconnaissance. Reconnaissance nmap -sC -sV -T4 -oN nmap.txt rootme Starting Nmap 7.60 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2022-12-20 21:29 GMT Nmap scan report for rootme (10.10.24.110) Host is up (0.

item.title: Overpass
item.description: Overpass What happens when some broke CompSci students make a password manager? A CTF room where we will be exploiting a web based password manager. The targets in this room are: user.txt root.txt We’ll start, as always, by adding the target’s ip address to our hosts file. echo target-ip overpass.thm >> /etc/hosts Recon Next, we’ll run an nmap scan of the server. nmap -sC -sV -T4 overpass.thm Starting Nmap 7.93 ( https://nmap.

item.title: Blog
item.description: Blog Billy Joel made a WordPress Blog! Blog, a CTF room based around exploiting a WordPress blog! We’ll start by adding the machine’s ip address to our hosts file. echo target-ip blog.thm >> /etc/hosts And then move on to some reconnaissance. Recon First we’ll run an nmap scan of the target, using nmap’s “default” scripts (-sC) and version scanner (-sV). nmap -sC -sV -T4 blog.thm Starting Nmap 7.93 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2023-01-05 02:16 EST Nmap scan report for blog.

item.title: OhSINT
item.description:
OhSINT

OhSINT, a room meant to test your skills using the OSINT framework.
